author: Hermann Hesse
quote: I live in my dreams — that's what you sense. Other people live in dreams, but not in their own. That's the difference.

author: Hermann Hesse
quote: Some of us think holding on makes us strong, but sometimes it is letting go.

author: Hermann Hesse
quote: You are willing to die, you coward, but not to live.

author: Hermann Hesse
quote: We do not know what is good for us and what is evil. There is no finality in the world for us, whether there is a God or not.

author: Hermann Hesse
quote: Each man had only one genuine vocation — to find the way to himself.

author: Hermann Hesse
quote: The bird fights its way out of the egg. The egg is the world. Who would be born must destroy a world.

author: Hermann Hesse
quote: I wanted only to try to live in accord with the promptings which came from my true self. Why was that so very difficult?

author: Osamu Dazai
quote: I am convinced that human life is filled with many pure, happy, serene examples of insincerity, truly splendid of their kind-of people deceiving one another without (strangely enough) any wounds being inflicted, of people who seem unaware even that they are deceiving one another.

author: Osamu Dazai
quote: Now I had realized that not only I, but all men were alone in this respect, and that they were imprisoned in their own natures and were thus suffocated in their own worlds.

author: Osamu Dazai
quote: Living is humiliating.

author: Osamu Dazai
quote: I didn’t want to gain anything. It was merely that my feelings would not allow me to turn my back on them.

author: Osamu Dazai
quote: And thus I leave my corpse to posterity.

author: Osamu Dazai
quote: The human trait of which I am most critical is the sense of justice.

author: Franz Kafka
quote: I cannot make you understand. I cannot make anyone understand what is happening inside me. I cannot even explain it to myself.

author: Franz Kafka
quote: I am in great pain, please help me.

author: Franz Kafka
quote: I'll have to set a good example and hope the others will make the effort themselves.

author: Franz Kafka
quote: Was he an animal, that music could move him so?

author: Franz Kafka
quote: I cannot stand it any more.

author: Franz Kafka
quote: Gregor Samsa found himself in his bed transformed into a gigantic insect.

author: André Gide
quote: Believe those who are seeking the truth. Doubt those who find it.

author: André Gide
quote: That is love, to give away everything, to sacrifice everything, without the slightest desire to get anything in return.

author: André Gide
quote: A mirror reflects a man's face, but what he is really like is shown by the kind of friends he chooses.

author: André Gide
quote: What can it matter to me, now, that I am happy and tranquil, since there is no longer any hope of rendering you so?

author: André Gide
quote: It seems to me that I am more to blame in my relations with others than in the matter of my relations with God.

author: André Gide
quote: He feels himself become doubly complete in his union with another, as if he were merged in him, and yet becomes less than himself, as if the other took something from him.

author: Albert Camus
quote: There is only one really serious philosophical question, and that is suicide.

author: Albert Camus
quote: The struggle itself toward the heights is enough to fill a man's heart. One must imagine Sisyphus happy.

author: Albert Camus
quote: The absurd is born of this confrontation between the human need and the unreasonable silence of the world.

author: Albert Camus
quote: In the depth of winter, I finally learned that within me there lay an invincible summer.

author: Albert Camus
quote: If the world were clear, art would not exist.

author: Albert Camus
quote: Freedom is nothing but a chance to be better.

author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky
quote: Man only likes to count his troubles; he doesn't calculate his happiness.

author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky
quote: I say let the world go to hell, but I should always have my tea.

author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky
quote: I am a sick man... I am a spiteful man. I am an unattractive man. I believe my liver is diseased.

author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky
quote: I swear to you gentlemen, that to be too conscious is an illness—a real thorough-going illness.

author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky
quote: People speak sometimes about the 'bestial' cruelty of man, but that is terribly unjust and offensive to beasts. No animal could ever be so cruel as a man, so artfully, so artistically cruel.

author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky
quote: What do you think? Am I a scoundrel, or an honest man?

author: André Gide
quote: The great artist is the man who most obviously succeeds in turning his pains to advantage, in letting suffering deepens his understanding and sensibility, in growing through his pains.

author: Albert Camus
quote: Mother died today. Or maybe yesterday; I can't be sure.

author: Albert Camus
quote: I opened myself to the gentle indifference of the world.

author: Albert Camus
quote: Since we're all going to die, it's obvious that when and how don't matter.

author: Albert Camus
quote: I may not have been sure about what really did interest me, but I was absolutely sure about what didn't.

author: Albert Camus
quote: For everything to be consummated, for me to feel less alone, I had only to wish that there be a large crowd of spectators the day of my execution and that they greet me with cries of hate.

author: Albert Camus
quote: I had only a little time left and I didn't want to waste it on God.

author: Albert Camus
quote: I felt the urge to reassure him that I was like everybody else, just like everybody else.

author: Hermann Hesse
quote: There is no reality except the one contained within us.

author: Hermann Hesse
quote: Loneliness is the way by which destiny endeavors to lead man to himself.

author: Hermann Hesse
quote: A man cannot live intensely except at the cost of the self.

author: Hermann Hesse
quote: We are sun and moon, dear friend; we are sea and land. It is not our purpose to become each other; it is to recognize each other, to learn to see the other and honor him for what he is: each the other's opposite and complement.

author: Hermann Hesse
quote: He who has a why to live can bear almost any how.

author: Hermann Hesse
quote: Words do not express thoughts very well. They always become a little different immediately after they are expressed, a little distorted, a little foolish.

author: Hermann Hesse
quote: The magic of the world, the meaning of our fate, was revealed in me.

author: Franz Kafka
quote: Someone must have been telling lies about Josef K., he knew he had done nothing wrong but, one morning, he was arrested.

author: Franz Kafka
quote: It's only because of their stupidity that they're able to be so sure of themselves.

author: Franz Kafka
quote: You are free, and that is why you are lost.

author: Franz Kafka
quote: But I'm not guilty, said K. There’s been a mistake. How is it even possible for someone to be guilty? We’re all human beings here, one like the other.

author: Franz Kafka
quote: Logic may indeed be unshakeable, but it cannot withstand a man who is determined to live.

author: Franz Kafka
quote: The Court wants nothing from you. It receives you when you come and it relinquishes you when you go.

author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky
quote: Beauty will save the world.

author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky
quote: To think too much is a disease.

author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky
quote: I say let the world go to hell, but I should always have my tea.

author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky
quote: The soul is healed by being with children.

author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky
quote: The more I love humanity in general, the less I love man in particular.

author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky
quote: A fool with a heart and no sense is just as unhappy as a fool with sense and no heart.

author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky
quote: Lying to ourselves is more deeply ingrained than lying to others.

author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky
quote: Compassion is the chief law of human existence.

author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky
quote: It takes something more than intelligence to act intelligently.

author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky
quote: Life is in ourselves and not in the external.

author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky
quote: The greatest happiness is to know the source of unhappiness.

author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky
quote: There is only one thing that I dread: not to be worthy of my sufferings.

author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky
quote: It is better to be unhappy and know the worst, than to be happy in a fool's paradise.

author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky
quote: To go wrong in one's own way is better than to go right in someone else's.

author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky
quote: Pain and suffering are always inevitable for a large intelligence and a deep heart. The really great men must, I think, have great sadness on earth.

author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky
quote: The darker the night, the brighter the stars, The deeper the grief, the closer is God!

author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky
quote: I did not bow down to you, I bowed down to all the suffering of humanity.

author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky
quote: The man who has a conscience suffers whilst acknowledging his sin. That is his punishment--as well as prison.

author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky
quote: What do you think, would not one tiny crime be wiped out by thousands of good deeds?

author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky
quote: If he has a conscience he will suffer for his mistake. That will be punishment--as well as the prison.

author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky
quote: Break what must be broken, once for all, that's all, and take the suffering on oneself.

author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky
quote: I swear to you gentlemen, that to be overly conscious is a sickness, a real, thorough sickness.

author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky
quote: Taking a new step, uttering a new word, is what people fear most.

author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky
quote: Man grows used to everything, the scoundrel!

author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky
quote: The best way to keep a prisoner from escaping is to make sure he never knows he's in prison.

author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky
quote: Power is given only to those who dare to lower themselves and pick it up. Only one thing matters, one thing; to be able to dare!

author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky
quote: When reason fails, the devil helps!

author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky
quote: The man who has a conscience suffers while acknowledging his sin. That is his punishment—as well as prison.

author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky
quote: What do you think, would not one tiny crime be wiped out by thousands of good deeds?

author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky
quote: Taking a new step, uttering a new word, is what people fear most.

author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky
quote: If there is no God, everything is permitted.

author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky
quote: What is hell? I maintain that it is the suffering of being unable to love.

author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky
quote: Above all, don't lie to yourself. The man who lies to himself and listens to his own lie comes to a point that he cannot distinguish the truth within him, or around him, and so loses all respect for himself and for others.

author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky
quote: The mystery of human existence lies not in just staying alive, but in finding something to live for.

author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky
quote: People speak sometimes about the 'bestial' cruelty of man, but that is terribly unjust and offensive to beasts, no animal could ever be so cruel as a man, so artfully, so artistically cruel.

author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky
quote: Nothing is easier than to denounce the evildoer; nothing is more difficult than to understand him.

author: Friedrich Nietzsche
quote: He who climbs upon the highest mountains laughs at all tragedies, real or imaginary.

author: Friedrich Nietzsche
quote: You must have chaos within you to give birth to a dancing star.

author: Friedrich Nietzsche
quote: The higher we soar, the smaller we appear to those who cannot fly.

author: Friedrich Nietzsche
quote: The lonely one offers his hand too quickly to whomever he encounters.

author: Friedrich Nietzsche
quote: He who has a why to live for can bear almost any how.

author: Friedrich Nietzsche
quote: I tell you: one must still have chaos within oneself, to give birth to a dancing star.

author: Friedrich Nietzsche
quote: One repays a teacher badly if one always remains nothing but a pupil.
